alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 2:06AM MDT until October 24 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .A strong low pressure system will bring accumulating snow to the area through the mid to late morning hours. The highest accumulations will be across the northwestern Black Hills into parts of far northeast Wyoming early this morning as upslope enhanced snow increases in intensity. Winds are expected to gust from 40 to over 50 mph at times through the morning, supporting areas of blowing and drifting snow with reduced visibility. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches, with 2 to 4 inches over the northwestern and west central Black Hills from Cheyenne Crossing to O`Neill Pass and areas west of Deerfield and Rochford. Little or no snow along and east of a line from near Pactola Lake to Hill City. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In South Dakota, the Northern Black Hills and the Central Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills. * WHEN...Until noon MDT today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
